--- title: Splenius Capitis --- ![Superficial intrinsic back muscles Right side posterior view @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020](/The Archive/Anatomy/Muscles/Muscles of the back/Superficial Intrinsic Back Muscles/images/gilroyatlas 3.8ab schematic superficial intrinsic back mm.png) ![Superficial intrinsic back muscles posterior view @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020](/The Archive/Anatomy/Muscles/Muscles of the back/Superficial Intrinsic Back Muscles/images/gilroyatlas 3.10a superficial intrinsic back mm .png) ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' tbl-cap='Splenius capitis muscle' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Splenius capitis Nuchal lig.
C7-T4 SP		 Lateral third of nuchal line
Mastoid process		 Spinal nn.
Posterior rami (lateral br.)
C1 - C6		 Bilateral: Head and neck extension
Unilateral: I/L sidebend, I/L rotation
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} - [Nuchal ligament]({{< var ref-nuchal-ligament.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - C7-T4 SP @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Finando suggests that this muscle actually originates from the fascia associated with C4-T4 spinous processes @finandoTriggerPointTherapy2005. # Insertion {#insertion} The insertion is also called the "proximal attachment" @finandoTriggerPointTherapy2005. The *splenius capitis* inserts proximally on: - Lateral 1/3 nuchal line (occipital bone) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Mastoid process (temporal bone) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 The muscle runs *deep* to the [sternocleidomastoid]({{< var ref-sternocleidomastoid.path >}}) # Innervation {#innervation} [spinal nn.]({{< var ref-spinal-nerves.path >}}) C1-C6 (Post rami, lateral branches) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **Bilateral:** Extends C/S and head @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - **Unilateral:** I/L head SB and Rotation @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Muscle groups Splenius Capitis is part of the [Superficial intrinsic back muscle group]({{< var ref-oians >}}) # Palpation {#palpation} # Clinical significance
